items.title: Sphinx-tabs are not working  with sphinx 3.0.4
items.body:
Hello,
I am working on OpenDaylight project as an intern and we planned to add ```code-tabs``` for our documentation but I get error like Unkown "tabs" even after adding the requirements in the required areas of documentation.

Is it not compatible with sphinx 3.0.4 version?

items.title: Could not install requirement from link included in the README.md
items.body:
Following the steps provided in the README.md section, building on readthedocs yields a `Could not install requirement` error on either of the two requirement links below:
* https://github.com/djungelorm/sphinx-tabs/releases/download/v1.1.12/sphinx-tabs-1.1.13.tar.gz
* https://krpc.s3.amazonaws.com/sphinx-tabs-1.1.12.tar.gz

The Releases folder is also not in the repo.

`Collecting https://github.com/djungelorm/sphinx-tabs/releases/download/v1.1.12/sphinx-tabs-1.1.13.tar.gz (from -r requirements.txt (line 3))`
`ERROR: HTTP error 404 while getting https://github.com/djungelorm/sphinx-tabs/releases/download/v1.1.12/sphinx-tabs-1.1.13.tar.gz`
`ERROR: Could not install requirement https://github.com/djungelorm/sphinx-tabs/releases/download/v1.1.12/sphinx-tabs-1.1.13.tar.gz (from -r requirements.txt (line 3)) because of error 404 Client Error: Not Found for url: https://github.com/djungelorm/sphinx-tabs/releases/download/v1.1.12/sphinx-tabs-1.1.13.tar.gz`
`ERROR: Could not install requirement https://github.com/djungelorm/sphinx-tabs/releases/download/v1.1.12/sphinx-tabs-1.1.13.tar.gz (from -r requirements.txt (line 3)) because of HTTP error 404 Client Error: Not Found for url: https://github.com/djungelorm/sphinx-tabs/releases/download/v1.1.12/sphinx-tabs-1.1.13.tar.gz for URL https://github.com/djungelorm/sphinx-tabs/releases/download/v1.1.12/sphinx-tabs-1.1.13.tar.gz`

Tabs are not showing even when building locally.

items.title: Maitenance status of project
items.body: Is this project still maintained?

items.title: Incorrect Release Link in README
items.body:
Just a little one, the RTD `requirements.txt` line hasn't properly been bumped to latest release version, it reads:
```
https://github.com/djungelorm/sphinx-tabs/releases/download/v1.1.12/sphinx-tabs-1.1.13.tar.gz
```

Whereas it should be
```
https://github.com/djungelorm/sphinx-tabs/releases/download/v1.1.13/sphinx-tabs-1.1.13.tar.gz
```

The `v1.1.12` after `download` should be `v1.1.13`

items.title: Tabs does not render correctly
items.body:
I copy/paste the example to my rst page, and I'm geeting the following ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/170200/71620082-7b4c2080-2bd0-11ea-8022-37374341119b.png) Do I need to update the CSS in any way? I'm using sphinx 1.8.0 The generated HTML looks correct ```
Apples
Pears
Oranges
Apples are green, or sometimes red.
Pears are green.
Oranges are orange.

items.title: Any way to customize the code-tab label/tab name
items.body: I show examples of how to run code using Python and R. But when I use ``` .. tabs:: .. code-tab:: r library(somelibrary) ``` The label in the output is "S". I'm assuming this has something to do with the R/S lexers http://pygments.org/docs/lexers/#lexers-for-the-r-s-languages. Is there any way to change the label? I tried using `group-tab` with coded text, but the highlighting is a little different.

Copying tabs assets... /deploy/sphinxext/sphinx_tabs/tabs.py:263: RemovedInSphinx20Warning: app.info() is now deprecated. Use sphinx.util.logging instead.

done
```

items.body:

```
Exception occurred:

AttributeError: 'Sphinx' object has no attribute 'warn'
```

If I find time and I'm able to reproduce locally as well, I'll try to send a PR.

items.body:
Hello Again!

Again,  I really appreciate having this nifty tool. Has helped me organize my work a whole lot easier.  

I was wondering, and this may or may not be an issue, I cannot get these tabs to work in internet explorer.  Clicking the tab does nothing.  Maybe it's a javascript issue? Firefox works fine. Don't know about chrome. Not using it.  Anyway, thought i'd let you know one developer to another.

items.title: declare if it is safe for parallel reading
items.body:
Hi,
thanks for the nice add-on !

Running ``sphinx-build`` in parallel ``j`` or in  ``nitpicky`` mode produces/stops with the following warning:
*WARNING: the sphinx_tabs.tabs extension does not declare if it is safe for parallel reading, assuming it isn't - please ask the extension author to check and make it explicit*

Here is the relevant information in the Sphinx documentation: http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/1.5.1/extdev/#extension-metadata.

items.title: Group tabs are no longer synced as of 1.1.9
items.body:
You can actually see this in the sample site[1].

In testing with one of my sites, the group synchronization worked in 1.1.8 but broke with 1.1.9.

Verified viewing in for Firefox and Chrome, just in case this was a browser issue.

[1] https://djungelorm.github.io/sphinx-tabs/

items.title: Tabs overflow
items.body: Very useful tool. It looks like when there are too many tabs it overflows the container. It would be nice if it either created a second row or at least had a scrollbar so that on small screens there would be some way of selecting things.

items.title: Nested Tabs
items.body: Great tool! Would be really nice if one could nest tabs within tabs. Is there any support for that on the horizon?

items.title: linkcheck warning: Not copying tabs assets! Not compatible with linkcheck builder
items.body:
I want to lint external links in my docs in the CI, so I want the `linkcheck` builder to fail on warnings. I use

```
sphinx-build -nW -b linkcheck . _build/
```

But then I get a following failure:

```
Not copying tabs assets! Not compatible with linkcheck builder
```

Is there a way how to overcome this?

items.title: Error when naming a tab as a number
items.body:
Creating a tab with the following

```rst
.. tabs::

   .. tab:: 404

       Not Found
```
resulting the following error when building the docs
```
Exception occurred:
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sphinx_tabs/tabs.py", line 89, in run
    args['tab_name'] = tab_name
TypeError: 'int' object does not support item assignment
```

I tried to fix this myself but I'm not sure under what conditions the directive content is interpreted as json.

items.title: code-tabs with linenos
items.body:
I missed the option to add `linenos` to the code-tabs, so I created a workaround.

```py
class CodeTabDirective(Directive):
    """ Tab directive with a codeblock as its content"""

    has_content = True
    option_spec = {
        'linenos': directives.flag
    }

    def run(self):
        """ Parse a tab directive """
        self.assert_has_content()

        args = self.content[0].strip().split()
        self.content.trim_start(2)

        lang = args[0]
        tab_name = ' '.join(args[1:]) if len(args) > 1 else LEXER_MAP[lang]

        for idx, line in enumerate(self.content.data):
            self.content.data[idx] = '      ' + line

        tab_args = {
            'tab_id': base64.b64encode(
                tab_name.encode('utf-8')).decode('utf-8'),
            'classes': ['code-tab'],
        }

        new_content = [
            '.. tab:: {}'.format(json.dumps(tab_args)),
            '   {}'.format(tab_name),
            '',
            '   .. code-block:: {}'.format(lang),
        ]

        if 'linenos' in self.options:
            new_content.append('      :linenos:')

        new_content.append('')

        for idx, line in enumerate(new_content):
            self.content.data.insert(idx, line)
            self.content.items.insert(idx, (None, idx))

        node = nodes.container()
        self.state.nested_parse(self.content, self.content_offset, node)
        return node.children
```

items.title: Add spelling builder to list of builders
items.body: ``WARNING: Not copying tabs assets! Not compatible with spelling builder`` is generated when Sphinx spelling builder is used. If spelling builder is added to list of builders, it would fix the issue.

items.title: Fallback for PDF generation
items.body:
It would be nice if sphinx_tabs had a useful fallback for pdf generation. ATM it renders like this:

### Apples
### Pears
### Oranges
```
Apples are green, or sometimes red.
```
```
Pears are green.
```
```
Oranges are orange.
```
It would be swell if it looked like this:

### Apples
```
Apples are green, or sometimes red.
```
### Pears
```
Pears are green.
```
### Oranges
```
Oranges are orange.
```

items.title: WARNING: Not copying tabs assets! Not compatible with readthedocsdirhtml builder
items.body:
Experiencing the titled issue on one read the docs page but not consistently. Snippet and links below. Has anyone else experienced this? Is there any workaround?

```
.. only:: html

   .. tabs::
     .. group-tab:: JSON

        .. literalinclude:: ../examples/policies/l3.json
     .. group-tab:: YAML

        .. literalinclude:: ../examples/policies/l3.yaml

.. only:: epub or latex

        .. literalinclude:: ../examples/policies/l3.json
```

- Works here http://scanfcilium.readthedocs.io/en/latest/policy.html#example-basic
- Warning here http://cilium.readthedocs.io/en/latest/policy/#example-basic

Thanks.

items.title: Including tabs directive cause pages to not build correctly
items.body: I discovered this today while working on some docs of mine. When using tab directives, the first page including them wouldn't load correctly. I messed around with it for a while and found that if I get rid of the tabs, the page loads fine. What's weirder is that it will only do it for one page, not all of them. My only guess is that it's overriding css somehow? I'm not entirely sure what the real problem is. I reverted the version to 1.1.2, and that fixed it.

items.title: :name: not working in code-tab
items.body: Tab names in code-tabs are not working. The following code ``` .. tabs:: .. code-tab:: scala :name: Scala 1 .. code-tab:: scala :name: Scala 2 ``` gives though I expect "Scala 1" tab and "Scala 2" tab.

items.title: stylesheet order prevents custom css overrides
items.body:
The stylesheets of `sphinx_tabs` get appended at the very last, which makes overriding CSS styles in a `custom.css` impossible (or I simply don't know how).

My `conf.py` which includes `sphinx_tabs`:
```
extensions = [
    'sphinx_tabs.tabs',
    'sphinx.ext.extlinks',
    'sphinx.ext.graphviz',
    'sphinx.ext.intersphinx',
    'sphinx.ext.todo',
    'alabaster',
    'ablog',
    'sphinxcontrib.blockdiag'
]

# [...]

# add custom css here
def setup(app):
    app.add_stylesheet('css/custom.css')  # may also be an URL

```

I try to override a sphinx_tabs style in my `_static/css/custom.css`:
```
.sphinx-tabs .sphinx-menu a.item {
    color: yellow !important;
}
```

This doesn't override the default color, as the `custom.css` needs to be the last file for that in my `index.html`:
```
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="../../../../_static/alabaster.css" type="text/css" />
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="../../../../_static/pygments.css" type="text/css" />
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="../../../../_static/css/custom.css" type="text/css" />
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="../../../../_static/sphinx_tabs/tabs.css" type="text/css" />
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="../../../../_static/sphinx_tabs/semantic-ui-2.2.10/segment.min.css" type="text/css" />
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="../../../../_static/sphinx_tabs/semantic-ui-2.2.10/menu.min.css" type="text/css" />
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="../../../../_static/sphinx_tabs/semantic-ui-2.2.10/tab.min.css" type="text/css" />
```

There's a good chance that I do something wrong, any help would be appreciated.

items.title: WARNING: Not copying tabs assets! Not compatible with dirhtml builder
items.body:
I tried to use the package in combination with the blog building packge `ablog`.
When building the code with `ablog build`, I get this warning:
```
WARNING: Not copying tabs assets! Not compatible with dirhtml builder
```

The following example content gets *not* rendered as tabs:
```
.. tabs::

   .. tab:: Apples

      Apples are green, or sometimes red.

   .. tab:: Pears

      Pears are green.

   .. tab:: Oranges

      Oranges are orange.
```

It gets rendered like this:
```
Apples
Pears
Oranges
Apples are green, or sometimes red.
Pears are green.
Oranges are orange.
```

I'd really love to use your package, it does exactly what I want with the interface I want.

items.title: Using variables inside of code tabs
items.body:
Is it possible to use some kind of variable mechanism in tabs contents?

I.e. i have such line in `conf.py`:

    my_config_value = 42
    rst_epilog = '.. |my_conf_val| replace:: %d' % my_config_value

And when i use it in some regular text like so:

    My config value is |my_conf_val|!

Sphinx nicely replace the var and output as follows:

    My config value is 42!

But when i try the same using this tabs extension:

    .. tabs::

        .. code-tab:: javascript

            // |my_conf_val|

I get unreplaced `|my_conf_val|` string in the output.

Is it possible to achieve something similar (variables) with this extension?

items.title: Multi tabs with the same title
Multi tabs with the same title.
Tab titles are rendered verbatim, without parsing any markup
items.body:
It would be very useful to be able to include markup in tab titles, as in the following example (which uses `group-tab` rather than `tab` due to the bug reported in  #8):

```
.. tabs::

   .. group-tab:: :math:`x = y`

      Variables are equal :math:`x = y`.

   .. group-tab:: :math:`x \neq y`

      Variables are not equal :math:`x \neq y`.
```

In the current version the `:math:` markup is rendered verbatim, and tab switching to the right-hand tab does not clear the display of the left-hand tab content.

items.title: Multi-word tab title raises exception during build
items.body:
If `.. tab::` is followed by more than a single word, as in this example

```
.. tabs::

   .. tab:: Red Apples

      Apples are green, or sometimes red.

   .. tab:: Pears

      Pears are green.
```

the sphinx build raises a `json.decoder.JSONDecodeError` exception. This bug does not seem to affect `.. group-tab::`.

items.title: Could it be possible to include the requirements (CSS/JS) only on pages using the extension?
items.body: Could it be possible to include the requirements (CSS/JS) only on pages using the `sphinx-tabs` extension ?

items.title: Adding a link to a live example
items.body:
Hi,

First, thanks and :clap: for this neat small Sphinx extension.
It's well done, easy to install and use, great! :1st_place_medal: !

If you want to add a link to a "live example", I wrote a small page demonstrating your extension for my (Sphinx powered) website: http://perso.crans.org/besson/test-tabs.en.html#details
![test tabs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11994719/26920439-5688e9fa-4c39-11e7-94b2-f88023295cc0.png)


Regards

items.title: css/tabs.css and js/tabs.js are missing

Thanks for updating the pypi package to 0.2.0!
Hmm, I'm having issues with the _static files on readthedocs but not locally

```
http://occa.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_static/sphinx_tabs/tabs.css Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (OK)
```

It looks like the right place, but I guess not :(
Any clues?

items.title: Rendering issue with readthedocs
items.body:
I happened to see this repo when I wanted to include tabs in readthedocs
Switching between tab contents worked!

However, there seems to be some css/rending issues
